If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.41-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @cead22 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761865677014229) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Workspace with members 1. Navigate to workspace settings 2. Open the member details page for any user 3. Locate the role selector (e.g., Member, Admin) 4. Select the same role the user currently has 5. Observe that an API call is still triggered despite no change occurring ## Expected Result: No API call should be made if the selected role is the same as the existing one. ## Actual Result: An API call to update the user’s role is triggered even though the value has not changed. ##Proposed Solution: Implement a validation check before making the update call, similar to the approach used in [updateGeneralSettings](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/libs/actions/Policy/Policy.ts#L1540-L1541), which verifies that the new value differs from the existing one before posting the update. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.41-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @iwiznia **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1761862095103959) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Enable rules in workspace settings and set flag amounts over for a category (Meals and Entertainment) 1. Create an expense and allow it to SmartScan 2. Select the category (Meals and Entertainment) 3. SmartScan detects an amount lower than the actual total 4. Manually edit the amount to a higher value 5. Observe the violations displayed on the report in NewDot 6. Open the same report in OldDot (expensify.com) ## Expected Result: Both violations — “Amount greater than scanned receipt” “Expense over category daily limit” — should display in NewDot just as they do in OldDot. ## Actual Result: Only “amount greater than scanned receipt” violation appears in NewDot. The “Expense over category daily limit” violation is missing from the expense and report view, though it appears correctly in OldDot. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

User is a admin of a control workspace that has enabled rules, tags & approvals in workflows 2. Admin has invited few members to WS 3. Admin has added tags Steps: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to workspace settings >> Tags 3. Select the added tag 4. Select approver field in tag rules 5. Select any user 6. Observe selected user is not reflected in Approver field 7. Select the approver field again & observe green checkmark displayed 8. Click back button twice 9. Select tag & observe the selected approver is now displayed 10. Unselect the user & observe user not removed below approver field ## Expected Result: On step 6 & 10 - Selected user should correctly reflected below Approver field when select & unselect users ## Actual Result: On step 6 & 10 - Selected user not reflected below Approver field when select & unselect users. If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.41-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1594/folder/13176707/41236876/983218013 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.80+ck103025@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Preconditions: 1. Admin - User is an Admin of a Control workspace where report fields with the types of text, date, formula and list (I added 2 types of text field, one each of date & list & formula type) have been created & initial values set up 2. Admin - has enabled tags & taxes features 3. Admin - has invited employee to workspace 4. Admin - Log out of account 1. Employee - Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Employee - Go to workspace chat & create expense 3. Admin - Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com & log in 4. Go to employee's workspace expense 5. Open the expense details 6. Try scrolling the expense details & observe page cannot be scrolled 7. Go back to expense preview & reopen the details page 8. Observe scrollbar appears & page can be scrolled completely ## Expected Result: On step 6 - Admin should be able to easily scroll the expense details page completely to view the details ## Actual Result: On step 6 - Admin cannot scroll & view the employee's expense details as scrollbar is missing. When admin navigates back to expense preview & revisit the details page, scrollbar is displayed and able to view the expense details Note: 1. Issue happens every time when admin logs out & log back in 2. Issue occurs on employee side too when he sign out & sign in back ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: $125 DRY up code that cleans up reports when policies are deleted

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem
We have some code that cleans up reports when a policy is deleted. That code has been duplicated in 3-4 files and is redundant.

### Solution
- Search the code for `// If we are deleting a policy, we have to check every report linked to that policy`
- You will find 3-4 instances of this
- Remove all but one of them
- Verify the functionality still works as intended

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @linhvovan29546</details>

title: [$250] Restore Type Safety for Onyx.update()

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Background: The frontend frequently reads and writes data to the backend using the Onyx data layer. Whenever a request is made, we optimistically set Onyx data via Onyx.update(). First updating the local cache, then syncing changes once the request succeeds/fails. During the migration to TypeScript, @fabioh8010 and I ensured this function and accompanying types were type-safe, meaning only values defined in the Onyx schema could be set under a specific key. This safeguard protected against corrupted data, unexpected keys, and typos in key names, improving developer experience and data reliability. ## Problem: It's possible to set any value to any key when using Onyx.update(): ```ts const optimisticData: OnyxUpdate[] = [ { onyxMethod: Onyx.METHOD.MERGE, key: ONYXKEYS.IS_LOADING_REPORT_DATA, // boolean value: 'whatever value', // this doesn't raise a type error }, ]; ``` ## Solution: Reintroduce the previous type definition in react-native-onyx (as it was implemented before PR #600) to restore schema-based type enforcement. Then: Update react-native-onyx in E/App. Resolve around 120 resulting type errors in E/App This change will restore strict type safety for Onyx.update(), preventing invalid data assignments at compile-time. In React-native-onyx this will also be included: - add a comment above this magic type so that nobody touches it again - add type tests to Onyx
